==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ぶ|おんな}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ぶおんな|醜|tr1=bu|t1=ugly|女|tr2=onna|t2=woman}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ぶおんな|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぶおんな|hhira=ぶをんな}}

# an [[ugly]] [[woman]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|醜女|しこめ}} {{qualifier|see below}}
* {{ja-r|醜女|しゅうじょ}} {{qualifier|see below}}
* {{ja-r|醜婦|しゅうふ}}
* {{ja-r|ぶす}}
* {{ja-r|おかちめんこ}}

=====Usage notes=====
For the generic “ugly woman” sense, the ''buonna'' reading may be more common. The ''shikome'' reading carries overtones of supernatural terror, and may be perceived as somewhat [[old-fashioned]]. The ''shūjo'' reading is the least common, and may be the most [[stilted]]; it is also the most [[negative]] of the three readings.
